meanings.definition: Moving or extending outward in a sweeping motion.
meanings.sent1: The tree's outsweeping branches provided ample shade on hot days.
meanings.sent2: Her outsweeping gesture welcomed everyone to the party.
meanings.sent3: The outsweeping wind blew my hat off!
meanings.sent4: The outsweeping view from the mountaintop took my breath away.
meanings.sent5: The outsweeping river meandered through the valley, reflecting the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The outsweeping of the broom cleared the path of fallen leaves.
meanings.sent2: I watched the outsweeping of the waves as they crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent3: The outsweeping of the crowd made it hard to see the stage.
meanings.sent4: The outsweeping of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The outsweeping of the dancer's arms captivated the audience.
